result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio R Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No Use or Possession of drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Co-Actor without prior Agent approval and the approval of all agencies involved.
No contact with the Drug Culture.
No contact with the victims A.W., S.Z. Clark Gas Station at 1436 E. Moreland Blvd.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Hearing on August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Julio R Alvarez in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Rosario makes a Motion to Dismiss. Statements presented by the State objecting to the Motion. Court finds there is enough in the Criminal Complaint to proceed. Court denies the request to dismiss Motion. Court takes a brief recess. Case resumes at 9:12 am, same appearances. Detective Timothy Probst from the City of Waukesha, sworn in and testifed. Cross examination by Atty. Rosario. Witness is excused. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Rosario requests to dismiss as to any robbery. Court notes on prior Motion that issue was previously dismissed.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.
